segments.en: “Mendicants, these four people are found in the world.

segments.pli: Kodhagaru na saddhammagaru, makkhagaru na saddhammagaru, lābhagaru na saddhammagaru, sakkāragaru na saddhammagaru.
segments.en: People who value anger, or denigration, or material possessions, or honor rather than the true teaching.

segments.pli: Ime kho, bhikkhave, cattāro puggalā santo saṃvijjamānā lokasmiṃ.
segments.en: These are the four people found in the world.

segments.pli: Cattārome, bhikkhave, puggalā santo saṃvijjamānā lokasmiṃ.
segments.en: These four people are found in the world.

segments.pli: Saddhammagaru na kodhagaru, saddhammagaru na makkhagaru, saddhammagaru na lābhagaru, saddhammagaru na sakkāragaru.
segments.en: People who value the true teaching rather than anger, or denigration, or material possessions, or honor.

segments.pli: Ime kho, bhikkhave, cattāro puggalā santo saṃvijjamānā lokasminti.
segments.en: These are the four people found in the world.
Mendicants who value anger and denigration,
that was taught by the perfected Buddha.
But those who value the true teaching,
who have lived it, and are living it now,
these do grow in the teaching
that was taught by the perfected Buddha.”

sections.title: “Mendicants, these four people are found in the world.…
